intro: Fridericia patellifera, commonly known as the flat-leaf fridericia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare species.
